node.title: Summer Walker Beats Abba’s First Album in Decades to No. 1
node.alt: Summer Walker’s second album is her first Billboard No. 1.
node.description: The Atlanta R&B singer’s “Still Over It” becomes her first LP to top the Billboard 200, with the equivalent of 166,000 sales in the United States.
node.content: ["When Abba, whose classic songs like \u201cDancing Queen\u201d and \u201cTake a Chance on Me\u201d are the epitome of Europop ear candy, announced in September that it would be returning this fall with its first studio album in 40 years, it was assumed that the new release would be an immediate blockbuster.", "The album, \u201cVoyage,\u201d came out on Nov. 5, and it has indeed reached higher on Billboard\u2019s chart than any previous Abba release \u2014 but it did not quite go to No. 1.", "\u201cVoyage\u201d opens at No. 2 with solid album sales but low streaming numbers, edged out by the latest from Summer Walker, a 25-year-old R&B singer from Atlanta.", "Walker\u2019s \u201cStill Over It\u201d becomes her first No. 1 album, with the equivalent of 166,000 sales in the United States, according to MRC Data, Billboard\u2019s tracking arm. Fans mostly consumed \u201cStill Over It,\u201d Walker\u2019s second album, on streaming services. It had 201 million clicks online and sold 12,000 copies as a complete package.", "Abba\u2019s \u201cVoyage\u201d had the equivalent of 82,000 sales; of those, 78,000 were attributed to copies sold as a complete package, including 42,000 CDs and 17,500 vinyl LPs. (It was available in eight vinyl configurations, including two picture discs and five color variants, in addition to standard black.) Songs from \u201cVoyage\u201d were steamed 4.9 million times \u2014 or about as many clicks as Walker got in four hours during her debut week.", "\u201cVoyage\u201d is also the title of Abba\u2019s virtual comeback concert, in which computer-generated \u201cAbbatars\u201d of its four members will perform with a live band in a custom-built venue in London, starting in May.", "\u201cWhat interested us was the idea that we could send them out while we can be at home cooking or walking the dog,\u201d Benny Andersson, one of the group\u2019s members, told The New York Times in a recent interview.", "Despite the enduring popularity of Abba\u2019s singles, its original albums were only moderate chart hits in the United States. According to Billboard, the group\u2019s highest-charting title before \u201cVoyage\u201d was \u201cAbba: The Album,\u201d which went to No. 14 in 1978. (Two Abba-related soundtracks did better: \u201cMamma Mia!\u201d went to No. 1 in 2008, and \u201cMamma Mia! Here We Go Again!\u201d landed at No. 3 a decade later.)", "Ed Sheeran\u2019s \u201c=,\u201d last week\u2019s top seller, falls to No. 4, while Drake\u2019s \u201cCertified Lover Boy\u201d is No. 3 and Morgan Wallen\u2019s \u201cDangerous: The Double Album\u201d is No. 5."]
